WYSIWYM.transformer
Class FeedbackTextGenerator

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.transformer.GraphTransformer
      WYSIWYM.transformer.SemanticGraphTransformer
          WYSIWYM.transformer.FeedbackTextGenerator
Direct Known Subclasses:
BrowsingGenerator, QueryBuilder
public class FeedbackTextGenerator
extends SemanticGraphTransformer

FeedbackTextGenerator steers the process of turning the semantic graph into a feedback text.

Version:
1.0 30-10-2006, 1.1 20-09-2007
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

Method Detail

undo

public boolean undo(boolean error)
             throws UndoException
Undoes the last operation performed. Throws an UndoException if undo was impossible; returns false if doing undo is, after this operation, no longer possible.

Parameters:
error - True if an error just occurred, and whatever information was added before that should be removed.
Returns:
True if this was a user-commissioned 'undo' action, and more additions can be undone, so undo should not be disabled. False in all cases.
Throws:
UndoException - if no information could be removed.

undo

public boolean undo()
             throws UndoException
Undoes the last operation performed. Throws an UndoException if undo was impossible; returns false if doing undo is, after this operation, no longer possible.

Returns:
True if this was a user-commissioned 'undo' action, and more additions can be undone, so undo should not be disabled. False in all cases.
Throws:
UndoException - if no information could be removed.

redo

public boolean redo()
Redo; replaces the current Graph with the Graph that was saved before the last 'undo' action. There is only a single redo!

Returns:
false if there was no saved graph, true if the operation succeeded

removeAnchor

public void removeAnchor(String anchor)
Removes the node with the given anchor from the Graph. All edges of the node are removed as well, and any nodes that because of this have no connection to the root node anymore. The results of this operation may be further reaching than the user intends, which is why we have implemented 'redo'!

Parameters:
anchor - Unique ID of Anchor

removePropertyValues

                                 String property,
                                 String[] values)
Removes the specified values that the node with this anchor has for this property.

Parameters:
anchor - Unique ID of Anchor
property - Property name
values - String[] array with values to be removed

public void update(String anchor,
                   String property,
                   String value)
            throws FolksonomyException
Updates the feedbacktext when the user has added a text value for a property with maximum cardinality 1.

Parameters:
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
property - The label of the selected property
value - The value the user specified for the range (can be null)
Throws:
FolksonomyException - if the tag could not be stored

updateDate

public void updateDate(String anchor,
                       String property,
                       String[] input)
                throws BadDateException
Updates a 'date' property, by creating a special 'vague date' node. Instead of using any of the RDF-datatypes that model dates or times, LIBER uses the Date class defined in the PolicyGrid Utility ontologies to store social-science dates. These dates can be specific to the day, or as vague as a century.

Parameters:
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
property - The label of the selected property
input - Contains the information needed to construct a date
Throws:
BadDateException - if the input was malformed

updateAbstract

public void updateAbstract(String anchor,
                           String property,
                           String value)
Updates the feedbacktext when the user has added an abstract for a property.

Parameters:
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
property - The label of the selected property
value - The String value the user specified (an abstract)

                                String property,
                                String[] values,
                                int datatype)
                         throws IOException,
                                FolksonomyException
Adds multiple values for one property in one go. Only for datatype properties.

Parameters:
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor

values - The String values the user specified
Throws:
IOException - if a value was the wrong type for this property
FolksonomyException - if the tag could not be stored

updateObjectPropWithNewInstance

public void updateObjectPropWithNewInstance(String property,
                                            String anchor,
                                            InstanceData instance,
                                            int seqNr)
Updates the SemanticGraph with an object property to a new instance, so that an edge and a new non-terminal node (+ unique id) are created.

Parameters:
property - The label of the selected property
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
instance - InstanceData with data specified about the individual in a form
seqNr - Sequence number; denotes the sequence of this edge in a series of identical edges. For instance, it might denote the second author of a paper.

updateObjectPropWithExistingInstance

public void updateObjectPropWithExistingInstance(String property,
                                                 String anchor,
                                                 SGNode target,
                                                 int seqNr)
Updates the SemanticGraph with an object property to an instance already in it.

Parameters:
property - The label of the selected property
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
target - The target node
seqNr - Sequence number; denotes the sequence of this edge in a series of identical edges. For instance, it might denote the second author of a paper.

updateObjectPropWithArchiveInstance

public void updateObjectPropWithArchiveInstance(String property,
                                                String anchor,
                                                String id,
                                                int seqNr)
                                         throws SesameException
Updates the SemanticGraph with an object property to an object from the archive, extracting the NL-information about that object from the archive.

Parameters:
property - The label of the selected property
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
id - Sesame ID of the individual
seqNr - Sequence number; denotes the sequence of this edge in a series of identical edges. For instance, it might denote the second author of a paper.
Throws:
SesameException - if there is an error retrieving information from the archive

updateObjectPropWithRangeObject

public void updateObjectPropWithRangeObject(String property,
                                            String anchor,
                                            SGNode target,
                                            int seqNr)
Adjusts the sequence number of the edge attaching the target node with the property to the node corresponding to the anchor.

Parameters:
property - The label of the selected property
anchor - The unique ID of an Anchor
target - Target node
seqNr - Sequence number; denotes the sequence of this edge in a series of identical edges. For instance, it might denote the second author of a paper.

                String anchor)
         throws NameAlreadyBoundException,

Deprecated. 

Imports the node from the given text generator into this one, together with all its information. Used in previous version of LIBER to export nodes from the browsing module to the editing module.

getSurfaceText

public AnchorInfo[] getSurfaceText(boolean undo)
                            throws SurfaceRealisationException,
                                   TextPlanningException
Returns the serialisable surface form of the FeedbackText as an array of AnchorInfo

Parameters:
undo - Set to false if no (more) undo is possible now; the last item in the array will be set to null, and this information causes the interface to disable the undo button.
Returns:
AnchorInfo[]
Throws:
SurfaceRealisationException - if an error occurred during surface realisation
TextPlanningException - if an error occurred during text planning

Parameters:
text - FeedbackText
Returns:
AnchorInfo[]

incrementLastOp

public void incrementLastOp()
Increments the last operation counter by one. When edges and nodes are added, they receive an operation value of this counter. This information is used by undo to find the edges and nodes that were added last. If the counter is set to 0, no more undo operations are possible.

printGraph

public static void printGraph(String name,
                              SemanticGraph graph)
Prints the SemanticGraph to a text file with the given name

Parameters:
name - Filename
graph - SemanticGraph
